glsa.title: Audacious: Multiple heap and buffer overflows
glsa.synopsis: The adplug library included in Audacious is vulnerable to various overflows that could result in the execution of arbitrary code.

background.p: Audacious is a media player that has been forked from Beep Media Player.

description.p: Luigi Auriemma has found that the adplug library fails to verify the size of the destination buffers in the unpacking instructions, resulting in various possible heap and buffer overflows.

impact.p: An attacker can entice a user to load a specially crafted media file, resulting in a crash or possible execution of arbitrary code.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All Audacious users should upgrade to the latest version:
